name: treacherous

treacherous adjective
(DANGEROUS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If the ground or sea is treacherous, it is extremely dangerous, especially because of bad weather conditions: Snow and ice have left many roads treacherous, and drivers are warned to use caution.

treacherous adjective
(NOT LOYAL)
A person who is treacherous deceives someone who trusts them, or has no loyalty: Vargas plays the part of a treacherous aristocrat who betrays his king and country. I feel a bit treacherous to my own sex if I ever make general criticisms of women.
